result.execSummary:
The defendant Sophia N Shelton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.  Court grants 20 days
credit if revoked.
Court does not object to transfer to Milwaukee County if accepted.

miscConds.notes: Absolute Sobriety.  No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 

NO CONTACT with Woodmans in Waukesha and Meijer's listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Restitution $1,434.86 for Woodman's and $346.04 to Meijer to be paid as a condition of probation, before costs and fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at Agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

supervisions.notes: Straight time. Consecutive to Count 2 if revoked.

Court does not object to transfer to Milwaukee County if accepted.

See Count 2 for Additional Conditions.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at Agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  Consecutive to Count 2.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Angela Wang advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 08/05/22 requesting a bail reduction hearing.

LF 8/11--no action needed; plea/sentencing was conducted on both matters.
Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 8/11/22.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

9:12 AM Defendant Sophia N Shelton in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Sophia N Shelton. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. 
Cases called for plea and sentencing.
State places offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 2-4.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Counts 1, & 5-6 are Dismissed and read in.
Case 22CM805 is Dismissed and read in.

State and Defense make sentencing recommendations. 
Defendant makes statement to the court.
**Court will vacate the bond forfeiture, reinstate the bond, and apply it to the restitution; 

Court orders the following:
COUNT 2: 

IMPOSED AND STAYED: 

JAIL:  30 Days - Straight-time.
20  Days Credit.

TERM ON PROBATION:  1.5  YEARS; Court does not object to transfer to Milwaukee County if accepted; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Absolute Sobriety; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*No contact with:  Woodman's in Waukesha, and Meijer's in criminal complaint; 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;

CONDITION TIME: 10 DAYS, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

RESTITUTION:  $1,434.86 to Woodman's and $346.04 to Meijer (Restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
COSTS:  $268
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
*********************************************
COUNT 3: 

IMPOSED AND STAYED: 

JAIL:  30 Days - Straight-time. Consecutive to Count 2; 
0  Days Credit.

TERM ON PROBATION:  1.5  YEARS; Court does not object to transfer to Milwaukee County if accepted; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Same as Count 1; 

CONDITION TIME: 10 DAYS, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  Consecutive to Count 2; 

COSTS:  $268
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
***********************************************
COUNT 4: 

IMPOSED AND STAYED: 

JAIL:  30 Days - Straight-time. Consecutive to Count 3; 
0  Days Credit.

TERM ON PROBATION:  1.5  YEARS; Court does not object to transfer to Milwaukee County if accepted; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Same as Count 1; 

COSTS:  $268
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

9:15 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sophia N Shelton in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Sophia N Shelton.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Date before the Trial Court shall remain as previously set.
to the Court filed by Atty. Angela Wang asking the Court convert 8/11 hearing to Plea and Sentencing as parties have reached resolution.
Bail/bond hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.  **Scheduling conflict; reset for 8/11.**
Motion to Modify Bail filed by Atty. Wang.
Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:19 AM Defendant Sophia N Shelton in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.   Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

After confiring with attorney Wang, the Defendant is requesting a prelim hearing and a bond hearing.
The State did not have their witness produced as a waiver was previously filed.
The Court notes that it will not hear a bond motion as that would need to go in front of the Trial Court.
The Court will adjourn the matter for a prelim hearing.
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Waiver was filed. Zoom may be granted.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Filed by Atty. Angela Wang.
